description:
iLUKA, part of the CSM Sports & Entertainment group, is a specialised agency, developing and delivering coordinated strategic activations for sponsors and other stakeholders at global events.

We are experts in executing cutting edge event hospitality experiences born from intelligent strategic direction. Our heritage is big events for big companies looking for strategic and measured solutions which focus on creating unforgettable experiences for stakeholders integral to sponsors success.

Our experience working with Sponsors, Organising Committees, International Sporting Federations, Governing Bodies and City stakeholders enables us to develop our clients sponsorship story to ensure that activations maximise the communication of their messages as well as guide global teams and their local markets through the unique complexities of delivering effectively at global events.


Specialties:

  • Sponsorship strategy, Sponsor activation, Hospitality, Showcasing, Recruitment and training of Games-time staff for clients, Operations- ticketing, transport, accommodation, Merchandise, Transport, Business engagement
     
  • For the global sporting event taking place in Sochi in 2014 we have a number of vacancies for experienced IT Managers, the right candidate will be Bilingual in Russian/English and have event IT experience.
  • The role is a fixed term contract starting November or January 2013 ending in February/March 2014, the role will be Accommodated.

DUE TO THE NUMBER OF APPLICATIONS WE RECEIVE, ONLY SUCESSFUL APPLICANTS WILL HEAR FROM US WITHIN 3 WEEKS.



Summary of Role and Key Responsibilities:

  • To set up and ensure all programme IT needs are catered for and fully supported
  • Ensure that all members of iLUKA staff have a properly configured and working computer that allows them to carry out their roles as efficiently as possible.
  • Continuously monitor user’s computers to ensure that they are working efficiently and securely.
  • Ensure all IT security policies are rigorously enforced at all times.
  • Implement all necessary security measures to protect the systems and Data of iLUKA.
  • Ensure all printers are fully operational and that spare consumables are always available.
  • Ensure the company telephone system is working efficiently and that the internal directory is up to date.
  • Responsible for the distribution, collection and monitoring of all mobile telephones. Monitor usage patterns and investigate any cost saving measures.
  • Where required assist iLUKAs Client’s and contractors with their IT needs.

Skills, Knowledge, Expertise:

  • Understanding of the urgency required in responding to time sensitive situations
  • Proactive approach to providing the highest level of service to the operational team
  • Previous experience of working on overseas Events and conferences or the setting up of temporary satellite offices would be beneficial.
  • Excellent communication skills – verbal & written
  • Knowledge and understanding of LAN administration in a secure environment.
  • Knowledge of a range of network systems, protocols, and applications.
  • Ability to determine computer problems and to coordinate hardware and/or software solutions.
  • Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical personnel.
  • Excellent knowledge of Windows 2003\2008, Exchange 2007\2010, Microsoft Lync 2010, backup solutions, DHCP, WINS, SNMP, DNS, Active Directory and SAN’s.
  • Experience of Blackberry solutions
  • Experience of installation and maintenance of SQL Server and IIS Servers.
  • Must have practical experience and expertise in both network and server security.
  • Cisco networking experience would be beneficial.

   


Attributes:

  •  High energy, comfortable working potentially long hours in a demanding but rewarding and friendly environment
  • Flexible, enthusiastic, confident, outgoing, well organised
  • Willing to roll sleeves up and get involved
